data.author: Zealotree
data.description:
-- TIME ROUND EXCLUSIVE --

An analogue clock that displays the time and date based on the positions of the clock. Telling the time is as simple as looking at the outer ring
 

Outer Ring (12 circles) tells the current hour, minute, and month clockwise. 

- Hour 12/December (0), Hour 3/March (3), Hour 6/June (6), Hour 9/September (9) are marked with a black ring for visibility.
- The black circle displays the current hour's position. It also displays the minute on the same circle.
- The current month has a red outline.


Middle Ring (30 + 1 circles) is the month dial. 
- Days divisible by 5 are marked with a black ring for visibility. 
- Day 30 is on the 12hr position.
- Day 31 is below Day 30. 
- The black circle displays today's date.

Inner Ring (7 circles) displays the week day. 
- Week starts on Sunday, on the 12hr position
- The black circle displays the current week day.

The Center AM/PM indicator, indicates the current AM/PM status. It turns red when it is a leap year.

Sample time and date in Screenshots:
1.  Sunday, December 31, 12:00 AM
2.  Tuesday, June 20, 2:13 PM
3.  Sunday, August 6, 5:25 PM
4.  Thursday, November 23, 11:10 PM
5.  (Colour Theme preview) Friday, July 8, 2:19 PM

Coming soon:
- Custom colours
- Hourly forecast

Inspiration:
Revolver by Pebble
Ochs Und Junior Perpetual Calendar
Orbit by Tom Medley

Note: Developers and Advanced Users can easily modify the Colour theme. Visit the Github Source Link and make the necessary changes to the "config.c" file before building.
data.title: Cirkular
